title: Subrepresentation
summary: In representation theory, a subrepresentation of a representation ( π , V ) {\displaystyle (\pi ,V)} of a group G is a representation ( π | W , W ) {\displaystyle (\pi |_{W},W)} such that W is a vector subspace of V and π | W ( g ) = π ( g ) | W {\displaystyle \pi |_{W}(g)=\pi (g)|_{W}} .
